greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f.: A(x) = exp( Sum_{n>=1} sigma(n)*x^n/(1+x^n) /n ).
comment: Also the number of partitions of n in which each part occurs a triangle number (>=0) times. - _Seiichi Manyama_, May 11 2018
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (first 1001 terms from Seiichi Manyama)
formula: Euler transform of A048272. [_Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 28 2009]
G.f.: 1/prod(n>=1, P(x^n)^((-1)^(n-1)) ) where P(x) = prod(k>=1, 1-x^k ), see Pari code. [_Joerg Arndt_, Jun 24 2011]
example: n | Partitions of n in which each part occurs a triangle number (>=0) times.
maple: b:= proc(n) option remember; -add((-1)^d, d=divisors(n)) end:
mathematica: nmax = 50; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 - x^(k*j))*(1 + x^(k*j))^2, {k, 1, nmax}, {j, 1, Floor[nmax/k] + 1}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 08 2018 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 28 2009
